name: EB Strict Rules
description: Strict Rules all EB Development will follow.

rules.justification: Required Variable Names meet Standard.
The name of temporary variable must be prefixed with Temp.
TextConst and Label variable names should have an approved suffix.
Required Explanation of Placeholders in Label Variable.
Variable declarations should be ordered by type.
Require Locked Label must have a suffix Tok.
Require that Global and Local Variable Names do not overlap.
Require that Non-Temporary Variables cannot be prefixed temp
Remove all unused variables to keep cleaner code.
No Duplications between Global and Local Variables
Do not use StrSubstNo in Error Messages
Function calls should have parenthesis even if they do not have any parameters.
The END, IF, REPEAT, UNTIL, FOR, WHILE, and CASE statement should always start a line.
Do not have identifiers with quotes in the name.
String parameters must match placeholders.
Don't write code that can never be hit
Only find record if you need to use it.
To avoid confusion, do not give local variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
To avoid confusion, do not give methods the same name as fields or actions in the same scope.
To avoid confusion, do not give global variables the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
Always initialize a variable before usage. This can improve readability and make debugging easier.
The variable '{Variable Name}' is initialized but not used.
Avoids a runtime error from using CalcFields on a field that is not a FlowField or a field of type Blob.
Use a text constant or label for format string in StrSubstNo.
Use a text constant for passing user messages and errors without concatenations.
The value of the Tooltip property of Fields must be filled.
The value of the Caption property of Fields must be filled in.
The local method must be used; otherwise removed.
To avoid confusion, do not give parameters the same name as fields, methods, or actions in the same scope.
